nasajpl1956501758857105596.content: Those swirls? They’re storms on Jupiter – and some are larger than Earth!  This enhanced color view of Jupiter’s south pole was created by a citizen scientist using raw data from the Juno spacecraft's JunoCam.
nasajpl1956501758857105596.author: nasajpl

nasajpl1950514474764685691.content: How will NISAR support agriculture and farming?  Hear from the scientists and end users how its data will be used to map crop growth, track plant health, and monitor soil moisture.
nasajpl1950514474764685691.author: nasajpl

nasajpl1940557360218755402.content: There's a new interstellar comet in the neighborhood!  Known as 3I/ATLAS, this comet poses no threat to Earth – but it does provide a rare opportunity to study an object that originated outside of our solar system:
nasajpl1940557360218755402.author: nasajpl

nasajpl1885372724106706994.content: LIVE NOW: Agency experts preview NASA’s SPHEREx mission, which will help scientists better understand the structure of the universe, how galaxies form and evolve, and the origins and abundance of water.
nasajpl1885372724106706994.author: nasajpl

nasajpl1885059238273110385.content: THIS FRIDAY: Learn more about SPHEREx, NASA's next cosmic mapmaker    Tune in at 9am PT / 12pm ET as experts from NASA and the mission talk about the space telescope's goals ahead of its launch, currently targeting Feb. 27:
nasajpl1885059238273110385.author: nasajpl

nasajpl1841571229670768716.content: Earth has a temporary, tiny companion.  While not quite a "mini moon," since it will never be captured by Earth's gravity, Asteroid 2024 PT5 does have a similar orbit as our planet and will linger in our vicinity for a few months.
nasajpl1841571229670768716.author: nasajpl
